intro: Sparattanthelium atrum, commonly known as the black-spored grass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of the northern hemisphere. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers in early spring. Its distinctive feature is the dark, almost black, spore-bearing structures that give it its common name. Sparattanthelium atrum plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various microorganisms.
